overview: Kevin co-founded Level 3 Communications Inc. and served as its Chief Operating Officer from March 1998 to March 2008 and its President from July 2000 to March 2008. He also served as a director of Level 3. During Kevinâ€™s tenure, the company grew to approximately $4.3B in annual revenue and approximately $825M of annual EBITDA. Prior to co-founding Level 3, Kevin was with MFS Global Network Services, Inc, serving as President and Chief Executive Officer from 1995 to 1997; as Senior Vice President of MFS and President of MFS Development Inc. from October 1992 to August 1995; and as a Vice President of MFS Telecom, Inc. from 1990 to 1992. While he was at MFS, annual revenue grew from a negligible amount to more than $2B. He left MFS after it was sold to WorldCom for approximately $14.5B. Kevin holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Drexel University and an MBA from the University of Chicago.
